metadata.title: BISR-RNAseq: an efficient and scalable RNAseq analysis workflow with interactive report generation
metadata.authors: Venkat Sundar Gadepalli, Hatice Gulcin Ozer, Ayse Selen Yilmaz, Maciej Pietrzak, Amy Webb
affiliations: Biomedical Informatics, The Ohio State University, Columbus, OH, USA
Biomedical Informatics, The Ohio State University, Columbus, OH, USA
Biomedical Informatics, The Ohio State University, Columbus, OH, USA
Biomedical Informatics, The Ohio State University, Columbus, OH, USA
Biomedical Informatics, The Ohio State University, Columbus, OH, USA
metadata.abstract:
Background: RNA sequencing has become anincreasingly affordable way to profile gene expression patterns.Here
weintroduce a workflow implementing severalopen-source softwares that can be run ona high performance
computing environment.
Results: DevelopedasatoolbytheBioinformaticsSharedResourceGroup(BISR)attheOhioStateUniversity,wehave
applied the pipeline to a few publicly available RNAseq datasets downloaded from GEO in order to demonstrate the
feasibility of this workflow. Source code is available here: workflow: https://code.bmi.osumc.edu/gadepalli.3/BISR-
RNAseq-ICIBM2019 and shiny: https://code.bmi.osumc.edu/gadepalli.3/BISR_RNASeq_ICIBM19. Example dataset is
demonstratedhere:https://dataportal.bmi.osumc.edu/RNA_Seq/.
Conclusion:Theworkflowallowsfortheanalysis(alignment,QC,gene-wisecountsgeneration)ofrawRNAseqdata
andseamlessintegrationofqualityanalysisanddifferentialexpressionresultsintoaconfigurableRshinyweb
application.

summary: RNA sequencing has become anincreasingly affluent in recent years . RNAseq analysis workflow is scalable and efficient . it is a scalable workflow with interactive report generation . Venkat Sundar Gadepalli1,2,3, Hatice Gulcin Ozer12,2,3, Ayse Selen Yilmaz12,3, Maciej Pietrzak1,2,3 and Amy Webb12,2 . DevelopedasatoolbytheBioinformaticsSharedResourceGroup (BISR)attheOhioStateUniversity applied the pipeline to a few publicly available RNAseq datasets downloaded from GEO .
